titles: A booke of notes and common places, with their expositions, collected and gathered out of the workes of diuers singular writers, and brought alphabetically into order. A worke both profitable and also necessarie, to those that desire the true vnderstanding & meaning of holy Scripture By Iohn Marbeck
author: Merbecke, John, ca. 1510-ca. 1585.
notes: The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "A" with ornament.
In some copies the table of contents ([par.]-2[par.] 3[par.]Â² ) is bound at the end rather than after the epistle dedicatory.
Running title reads: Common places, with their expositions.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
